# Interactive Quiz {.unnumbered}

Test your knowledge with an interactive quiz covering all topics from this guide!

## About the Quiz

The quiz contains **31 questions** organized into 9 sections:

- Color gradients and palettes (7 questions)
- Heatmap scaling (3 questions)
- File formats (5 questions)
- Text sizing (2 questions)
- Themes and styling (2 questions)
- Saving plots (3 questions)
- Post-processing (2 questions)
- Factor ordering (3 questions)
- Interactive plots (4 questions)

## Features

- ‚úÖ Progressive format (one section at a time)
- ‚úÖ Immediate feedback with explanations
- ‚úÖ Retry functionality for learning
- ‚úÖ Performance-based guidance
- ‚úÖ Clean, interactive interface

## Taking the Quiz

The quiz requires an R Shiny server to run, so it's only available locally (not on the website).

### Running Locally

Clone the repository and run the quiz on your machine:

```r
# Install learnr if needed
if (!requireNamespace("learnr", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("learnr")
}

# Run the quiz
rmarkdown::run("quiz.Rmd")
```

The quiz will open in your web browser.

## Score Interpretation

After completing the quiz, you'll receive guidance based on your performance:

- **üåü Excellent (80%+)**: You have a strong grasp of the material
- **‚úÖ Good (60-79%)**: You understand most concepts, review missed sections
- **üìö Needs Work (40-59%)**: Review the full guide and retake the quiz
- **‚ö†Ô∏è Please Retake (<40%)**: Study the material carefully before retrying

## Troubleshooting

If you encounter a namespace error when running locally, restart your R session first:

```r
# In RStudio
.rs.restartR()

# Then run the quiz
rmarkdown::run("quiz.Rmd")
```

## Using the Quiz

The quiz is ideal for:

- **Self-assessment** after reading the guide
- **Workshop activities** as a follow-up to presentations
- **Study groups** for collaborative learning
- **Course assignments** for graduate-level courses
